column4: Is it possible to beat udev bloody and tell it to stop trying to load my ATI card APCI but everything else APCI?
Booting with the grub option APCI off kills my volume roller.

niel127 basically if I have ACPI on, udev hangs my boot for six to ten minutes trying to load my ATI card (which comes up fine without udev's interference, the proprietary driver works fine) but with it off, I have no volume control.
you may have to blacklist a kernel module from loading.  Unfortunately I'm not sure how to do this :/
that's a fine start, I'll start researching.
